Class FlightBoardImplementation

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.game.FlightBoardImplementation
public class FlightBoardImplementation extends Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    FlightBoardImplementation(FlightType flightType, List<Player> initialOrderOfPlayers)
    the following method is the constructor of the FlightBoardImplementation class; it takes care of initializing an array of flightboardcells, such that its size and the initial position of the players determined by the flightType, as specified by the rules of the game

  • Constructor Details

    • FlightBoardImplementation

      public FlightBoardImplementation(FlightType flightType, List<Player> initialOrderOfPlayers) throws Exception
      the following method is the constructor of the FlightBoardImplementation class; it takes care of initializing an array of flightboardcells, such that its size and the initial position of the players determined by the flightType, as specified by the rules of the game
      Parameters:
      flightType - is an enum whose value determine the type of game that is being player (eg: TWO -> indicates a level two flight, whereas TRIAL -> indicates a trial flight)
      initialOrderOfPlayers - specifies the order by which each finished building their rocketship the first player in the first player that finished building its ship, and so on the third and forth player are added to the flight board only if a 3 or 4 player match si being played, respectively
      Throws:
      Exception

  • Method Details

    • getCellAt

      public FlightBoardCell getCellAt(int flightBoardPosition)
      getCellAt() returns the cell that corresponds to a specific position on the flightboard
      Parameters:
      flightBoardPosition - is an integer specifying the position on the flightboard, where 0 corresponds to the first position on the flightboard, and getFlightBoardSize()-1 corresponds to the last position on the flightboard
      Returns:
      the requested cell

    • getFlightBoardSize

      public int getFlightBoardSize()
      getFLightBoardSize() returns the size of the flightboard in a way that is independent of the data structure that is used to implement it
      Returns:
      an int that corresponds to the size of the flightboard, set during the construction, and dependent on the flight type

    • isCellFree

      public boolean isCellFree(int flightBoardPosition)
      isCellFree() simply checks whether the cell specified in the parameter is free or not
      Parameters:
      flightBoardPosition - is an integer specifying the desired position on the board
      Returns:
      true if the cell is free false otherwise

    • getPlayerPosition

      public int getPlayerPosition(Player requestedPlayer) throws Exception
      getPlayerPosition() checks each cell from the first to the last, until it finds the requested player
      Parameters:
      requestedPlayer - is the very player whose position on the board that the calling method wants
      Returns:
      the int corresponding to the requested player's position
      Throws:
      Exception - if the player is not on the board

    • getNextPosition

      public int getNextPosition(int currentPosition)
      getNextPosition() seeks the next position on the board, starting from the one that it receives as input. It's used to model the board as a circular path, although the data structure under it's not
      Parameters:
      currentPosition - is the position whose next the calling method wants to get
      Returns:
      the next position, which is zero if currentPosition was the last on the board

    • getPreviousPosition

      public int getPreviousPosition(int currentPosition)
      getPreviousPosition() is the dual method to getNextPosition(), but to get the previous position
      Parameters:
      currentPosition - is the position whose previous the calling method wants to get
      Returns:
      the previous position, which is the last on the board if currentPosition was the first

    • getNextFreePosition

      public int getNextFreePosition(int startingPosition)
      getNextFreePosition() increases the current position until there a cell containing no player is found this is because the rules of the game prohibit a cell to contain more than one player and so a player can't be moved to a cell that already contains a player
      Parameters:
      startingPosition - is the position that the method starts checking forward from
      Returns:
      the position of the next free cell, which may be lower than the starting position if the end of the board is reached

    • getPreviousFreePosition

      public int getPreviousFreePosition(int startingPosition)
      getPreviousFreePosition is the dual method to getNextFreePosition()
      Parameters:
      startingPosition - is the position that the method starts checking backward from
      Returns:
      the position of the first cell before the specified one that is found to be free such position may be higher than the starting position if the first position is crossed

    • movePlayerForwardByOne

      public void movePlayerForwardByOne(Player player) throws Exception
      movePlayerForwardByOne() removes the player from their current cell, and moves them to the next free cell
      Parameters:
      player - is the player that is to be moved
      Throws:
      Exception

    • movePlayerBackwardByOne

      public void movePlayerBackwardByOne(Player player) throws Exception
      movePlayerBackwardByOne() removes the player from their current cell, and moves them to the first cell before the one they're currently in that is found to be free
      Parameters:
      player - is the player that is to be moved
      Throws:
      Exception

    • getAllPlayersProgression

      public Map<Player,Integer> getAllPlayersProgression()
      getAllPlayersProgression() is used to know where each player is on the map
      Returns:
      a map that contains the minimal sufficient information on the players' relative positions, in order to later construct data structures containing their order, in a way that is independent of the flight board implementation, or to check if a player has been lapped

    • removePlayerFromBoard

      public void removePlayerFromBoard(Player playerToRemove) throws Exception
      removePlayerFromBoard simply removes the player from the board
      Parameters:
      playerToRemove - is the player that is to be removed from the board
      Throws:
      Exception

    • getFlightBoardRepresentation

      public List<PlayerColor> getFlightBoardRepresentation()
